label: 陽復記
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: [Work by Watarai Nobuyoshi, in which] he argued in a clear, rationalistic fashion that devoted performance of one's allotted social function conformed to the teachings of the kami and that on this point the moral philosophy of Shinto and Confucianism were the same (p. 416).[度会延佳]
